ygData.subject: Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: Well my only gripe is after delving in Paw for a couple of hours with my enchanter, wizard, and druid friend, they all can gate while I have to make the long
ygData.messageBody:
Well my only gripe is after delving in Paw for a couple of hours
with my enchanter, wizard, and druid friend, they all can gate
while I have to make the long trek back to Qeynos on foot. Of
course when they get to be level 29 and 30 they get group gate :)

> ----------
> From: Kelly[SMTP:pruett@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 7:11 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
>
> From: Kelly <pruett@...>
>
> Brian,
> I saw a unique way to do that in another game. They added a ring for high
> level
> players only. When you got to a spot you liked you "turned" the ring.
> After that
> you could go anywhere ... then again "turn" the ring and .... poof, you
> were
> back at your bound ring spot. It was SUCH a cool item.
>
> Unfortunately, I think the Verant guys want to keep people separated for
> some
> reason in this game (zone server reasons maybe??) There does need to be a
> way
> to stay somewhere though ... maybe they could balance it with a high cost
> or
> something.
>
> -Faderic
>
>
> "Jones, Brian" wrote:
>
> > From: "Jones, Brian" <brian.jones@...>
> >
> > Um, which part did you think was funny? The ultimate weapon
> > or the boots? :) I really, seriously would like a magic item for
> > warriors to be able to gate back to their bound spot. Or at least
> > give a spell to a wizard that allows you to gate them back (they
> > are still not able to bind you anywhere but a city).
> >
>
>
